summary: The document is a classified FBI record from the JFK Assassination Records Collection, focusing on the investigation of Santiago Alvarez Rodriguez, a former Cuban senator, for his activities related to Cuban revolutionary matters. It highlights the CIA's interest in Rodriguez and his son, along with a yacht named 'Alisan', and mentions a scandal sheet 'Esbirros' targeting Cuban groups. The case was closed due to Rodriguez's inactivity but noted the possibility of reopening if he engaged in anti-Castro activities.
key_findings: The document is part of the JFK Assassination Records Collection, released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It details the FBI's investigation into Santiago Alvarez Rodriguez's involvement in Cuban revolutionary matters.
The CIA had operational interest in Rodriguez and his son, as well as a yacht named 'Alisan'.
A scandal sheet called 'Esbirros' was mentioned, which targeted various Cuban groups and individuals.
The case was closed due to Rodriguez's inactivity but could be reopened if he became active in anti-Castro activities.
